resources.string: प्रोफ़ाइल को सक्रिय करने के बाद बंद करें
प्रोफ़ाइल सक्रिय करने की पुष्टि करें
प्रोफ़ाइल को सक्रिय करने के लिए लंबे समय तक दबाएं
प्राथमिकताएं संकेतक के साथ सक्रिय प्रोफ़ाइल प्रदर्शित करता है । स्पर्श पर उत्प्रेरक खोलता है ।
मैन्युअल सक्रियण पर ध्यान न दें
इवेंट प्रारंभ करें जब भी कोई मैंयुअल रूप से सक्रिय प्रोफ़ाइल है
पास नहीं (स्कैनिंग रेंज के भीतर नहीं)
लॉक खुले होने पर प्रारंभ करें
लॉक बंद होने पर समाप्त करें

लॉक बंद होने पर समाप्त करें
ब्लूटूथ को फिर से स्कैन करें
पास नहीं (स्कैनिंग रेंज के भीतर नहीं)

अवधि समाप्त होने के बाद-पूर्ववत प्रोफ़ाइल
अवधि समाप्त होने के बाद-पूर्ववत प्रोफ़ाइल
अवधि समाप्त होने के बाद-पुनरारंभ ईवेंट्स
स्टेटस बार और लॉकस्क्रीन में दिखाएं
चालू घटना को रोके और सभी घटना को पुनः प्रारंभ कर
ईवेंट को रोकें-ईवेंट्स को सक्रिय और पुनरारंभ करें
रिंगटोन और अधिसूचनाओं की ध्वनिमात्राएं जोड़ें
महत्वपूर्ण जानकारी दिखाने के लिए यहां क्लिक करें

इवेंट प्रारंभ नहीं होगा जब: \ n1 । आप अक्षम वैश्विक घटनाओं चलाने (लाल \"यातायात प्रकाश\")-यह संपादक मेनू में सक्षम आइटम के साथ \"घटनाओं रन सक्षम\" .\n2. आप मैंयुअल रूप से एक प्रोफ़ाइल (नारंगी \"यातायात प्रकाश\") सक्रिय-आप घटनाओं को पुनः आरंभ करना चाहिए । उत्प्रेरक, संपादक या अधिसूचना में शीर्षक में पुनः आरंभ घटनाओं आइकन का प्रयोग करें । मैन्युअल रूप से सक्रिय प्रोफ़ाइल्स प्रोफ़ाइल नाम के सामने \"[M]\" के साथ इंगित किया गया है । अपवाद लागू होता है जब घटना है \"मैंयुअल सक्रियण पर ध्यान न दें\" वरीयता चेक. \ n3 । आप ईवेंट प्राथमिकताएँ-इवेंट प्राथमिकताएँ \"चलाएँ सक्षम करें\" में इवेंट चलाएँ अक्षम करें जाँच द्वारा आवश्यक है. \ nNote: \"यातायात प्रकाश\" उत्प्रेरक और संपादक के शीर्षक में है ।
कुछ प्रोफ़ाइल प्राथमिकताएं रूट विशेषाधिकार की आवश्यकता है । ये प्राथमिकताएं \"(R)\" के साथ चिह्नित हैं ।
[#] केवल तभी प्रारंभ करें जब निंन प्रोफ़ाइल सक्रिय हो
आप वाइल्डकार्ड का उपयोग कर सकते हैं: \"%\" = एकाधिक वर्ण, \"_\" = एक वर्ण ।
सोनी उपकरणों के लिए, कृपया \"पावर प्रबंधन\" में \"सहनशक्ति\" मोड सक्षम करें। कृपया \"स्टैंडबाय में सक्रिय ऐप्स\" में फोनप्रोफाइलप्लस भी जोड़ें। इसके बिना, आवेदन सही ढंग से काम नहीं करेगा।
कुछ प्रोफ़ाइल प्राथमिकताएं रूट विशेषाधिकार की आवश्यकता है । ये प्राथमिकताएं \"(R)\" के साथ चिह्नित हैं ।
सूचना पैरामीटर सक्षम करने के लिए, सिस्टम सेटिंग्स में PhoneProfiles \"सूचना पहुंच\" की अनुमति दें ।
\"घंटी मोड\" प्रोफ़ाइल में \"व्यवधान\" के लिए PhoneProfiles को \"सूचना पहुंच\" सिस्टम सेटिंग्स में सक्षम करने की आवश्यकता है ।यहां क्लिक करें और सक्षम करें PhoneProfiles ।
कोई व्यवधान नहीं; अलार्म भी नहीं
To enable Notification sensor, allow PhoneProfiles \"Notification access\" in system settings.

कुछ अनुमतियां दी जाने की आवश्यकता है ।
टोन की स्थापना \"PhoneProfiles मूक\" क्योंकि यह कुछ अनुमतियों की आवश्यकता है निष्पादित नहीं किया जा सकता है ।

\"PhoneProfiles मूक\" टोन स्थापित करते समय त्रुटि!
अनुमतियाँ पहले से ही दी गई हैं
वॉलपेपर का चयन कुछ अनुमतियों की आवश्यकता है.

किसी कस्टम प्रोफ़ाइल चिह्न का चयन करने के लिए कुछ अनुमतियों की आवश्यकता है ।

In Android 6, it is not possible to change the \"Vibrate when ringing\" system setting on non-rooted devices.
In Android 6+, it is not possible to change the level of \"Adaptive brightness\" on non-rooted devices.
In Android 6+, for Wi-Fi scanning to work, you must enable Location and Wi-Fi scanning in Location settings.
In Android 6+, for Bluetooth LE scanning to work, you must enable Location and Bluetooth scanning in Location settings.
ROOT required to change adaptive level.
Profiles can be activated in one of two modes:
1. Manual activation - activated in Activator, Editor, notification, widget, shortcut. Manually activated profiles are indicated with \"[M]\" in front of the profile name.
2. Event activation - activated by an event.
Manual activation pauses all events, which will never start. You must manually Restart events to resume normal event function.
जब आप \"मैन्युअल सक्रियण पर ध्यान न दें\" वरीयता सेट इस नियम के अपवाद लागू होता है ।
घटना पुनः आरंभ उत्प्रेरक, संपादक या अधिसूचना के माध्यम से लाया जा सकता है ।
दोनों उत्प्रेरक और संपादक के शीर्षक में एक \"यातायात प्रकाश\" है ।
- Orange: events cannot start - profile was activated manually.
- Red: events are stopped - events run can be enabled through Editor menu item \"Enable events run\".

Android 6+ implements \"Doze mode\" and \"App Standby\". Concerning problems with event profile activation, if you leave the device unplugged and stationary for a period of time with the screen off, click here to add PhoneProfiles into \"Not optimized\".
An event may be in one of 6 states:
Running: event is started and running. Event parameters are satisfied.
Paused: event is not running. Event parameters are not satisfied. Event is waiting for parameters to be satisfied.
Stopped: event is stopped and cannot be started. Event parameter \"Enable run\" is not checked.
Paused with delay: event is started, but is waiting for the delay to expire. Event parameters are satisfied.
When no events are running, the \"Default profile\" is enabled if configured. You can configure a default profile in application settings in \"Profile activation\". Click here to configure it.

How \"volume separation\" works: Profile activation adjusts device volume by the running profile notifications volume level. When call ringing is detected, the ringing volume level from the running profile is adjusted. After the call ends, the notification volume level from the running profile is restored.
Can\'t delete; location currently in use in another event.

Event will start only when all \"Enable sensor\" checked sensor parameters are fulfilled. Running event will end if some checked sensor parameters are not fulfilled. Check only those sensors you need for this event. Checked sensor name is marked with bold text.\n\nSome sensor parameters are needed. Needed parameter names are marked with underlined text. If some needed parameters are not configured, event will not start, and parameter \"Enable sensor\" will be unchecked.
Some devices do not support colorful icons in the status bar.
For truly silent notification volume, configure notification tone to \"PhoneProfiles Silent\".
Notification tone \"PhoneProfiles Silent\" is not installed. Please install it from Editor menu and try again.
Your device has linked volume levels for ringtone and notifications. You can use \"Unlink ringer and notification volumes\". Click here to configure it.
Your device has linked volumes for ringtone and notifications. If you want unlinked volumes, enable this parameter.
Enable usage of parameter \"Priority\" in application settings.
If ringtone volume is set to \"0\", it configures the device for silent mode. Notification volume is ignored.

Ongoing status bar notification is required for PhoneProfilesService to operate properly. With notification, PhoneProfilesService is changed to \"foreground service,\" which is not killed by Android. PhoneProfilesService must run permanently.
Priority functionality: Event will not start if another running event has a higher priority level.
Bluetooth types: [CL] classic, [LE] low energy, [DU] dual.
This sensor will start an event by time. Parameters: Start time, End time, Days of week.
This sensor will start an event by calendar event. Parameters: Calendars, Search field (Event name, Description, etc.), Search string, Ignore \"All day\" events, Availability (Busy, Free, etc.).
This sensor will start an event by battery level. Parameters: Low level, Upper level, Charging, Power save mode.
This sensor will start an event by calling contacts. Parameters: Call event (Ringing, Outgoing call started, etc.), Contact groups, Contacts, Contact list type (white/black list).
This sensor will start an event by received SMS/MMS from contacts. Parameters: Contact groups, Contacts, Contact list type (white/black list), Permanent run, Duration (event run duration).
This sensor will start an event by device location. Parameters: Location, Start when outside location.
This sensor will start an event by Wi-Fi SSID. Parameters: Connection Type (Nearby, Connected, etc.), SSID.
This sensor will start an event by Bluetooth name. Parameters: Connection Type (Nearby, Connected, etc.), Scanned device type (Classic, Low energy, etc.), Bluetooth name.
This sensor will start an event by connected mobile cells (towers). Parameters: Cells, Start when outside cells.
This sensor will start an event by connected accessory (car dock, hands-free, headphones, etc.). Parameters: Accessories type.
This sensor will start an event by screen on/off. Parameters: Event type (screen on, screen off, etc.), End when unlocked (event ends when device unlocked).
This sensor will start an event by notification from applications. Parameters: Applications, End when dismissed (end of event at notification dismissal), Permanent run, Duration (event run duration).
This sensor will start an event by application in foreground. Parameters: Applications.

This sensor will start an event by device orientation. Parameters: Display (Up, down), Sides (Horizontal, side up), Distance (Near, far; used is proximity sensor), Ignore for applications (in foreground).
This sensor will start an event by NFC tags. Parameters: NFC tags, Permanent run, Duration (event run duration).

Click this to restart events. You must restart events if you have a manually activated profile.

This sensor will start an event by switching radios (on/off). Parameters: Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Mobile data, GPS, NFC, Airplane mode.
State of all radios must be fulfilled to start event. Configure only those radios that you need.

Some profile preferences require permission WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS. ROOT is not required. These preferences are marked with \"(G1)\".
For more information, look at the \"Profiles\" section further below.
For more information see \"Important information\", section \"Profiles\".
Profile parameters marked with (GX) need special permission for PhoneProfiles. This is done through your PC with installed adb.
If you do not have adb installed on your PC:
1. On your device, go into Settings > About > Software Information and click on Build Number 7 times. This will unlock and display Developer Options in Settings.
2. Go into Settings > Developer Options and enable USB Debugging.
3. On your PC, open a Command Prompt (Windows), or Terminal (Linux, OSX). Navigate to the folder where you extracted your adb files, and EXACTLY execute the following command:
4. After successful execution, all profile parameters marked with (G1) will be enabled.
1. PROFILES: Specifies how to change device settings.
2. EVENTS: Specifies when to change device settings.

PROFILES: Allow you to configure device settings such as ringer mode, volume levels, ringtone and notification sounds, radio switch (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, mobile data, etc.). When a profile is activated, the corresponding settings are permanent. If you want settings to change, another profile must be activated.
Profiles can be activated manually, or by an Event.

You can manually activate a profile through the PPP Activator (pop-up window with list of available profiles). The Activator can be displayed via the PPP home icon, the PPP notification, PPP widgets, DashClock widget and, for Samsung Edge devices, from the Edge panel. You can also directly activate a profile through the PPP 4x4 widget, a shortcut to the profile or, on Samsung Edge devices, through the Edge panel.
EVENTS: Allow you to configure when a profile activates. Events have a start and end. You can configure what will happen at the start of an event, and what will happen when the event ends.
Events contain important sensor configuration parameters, which must all be satisfied before an event is triggered. If any sensor does not pass, the event will end (pause).
• Time sensor: Start and End on a specified day of the week, or at a specified time.

• Wi-Fi sensor: Start and End by Wi-Fi SSID (connected, device nearby). The Nearby feature is useful to detect device location. For example: Start event when the device is within scanning range of your home Wi-Fi network.
• Bluetooth sensor: Similar to Wi-Fi sensor. Useful for car Bluetooth.
• Location sensor: Start and End by device location (GPS). You must enable Location Services in device system settings.
• Mobile cell sensor: Start and End by connection to or disconnection from mobile cell towers.
• Call sensor: Start and End via configured contacts. For example, when ringing.
• Accessories sensor: Start an event when, for example, headphones are connected.
• NFC sensor: Start an event via NFC tags.

If you manually activate a profile (not by an event), all running events are ended (paused). Events will not start during manual profile activation. However, you can override this behavior via the \"Ignore manual activation\" setting in event parameters.

Profiles and Events are configured in the Editor, which you can invoke through the Activator. Within the Editor you can add, duplicate, update, and delete profiles and events. The Editor has a left side panel, which allows you to change the Editor view. Use it to switch between profile and event lists.
Do not pause during manual activation

To enable \"Applications\" parameter, allow PhoneProfilesPlusExtender \"Accessibility\" in system settings.

To enable \"Applications\" parameter, click here to install PhoneProfilesPlusExtender.
To enable \"Ignore for applications\" parameter, click here to install PhoneProfilesPlusExtender.
Click here to check for changes and upgrade PhoneProfilesPlusExtender.

Due to a change of rules by Google, about usage of accessibility services, you must install PhoneProfilesPlusExtender to use the Application event sensor and Orientation event sensor. Check the parameters of these sensors for more information.

किसी अंय डिवाइस से हॉटस्पॉट में कनेक्शन काम नहीं कर सकता है ।
सक्रिय प्रोफ़ाइल के साथ प्रारंभ ईवेंट दिखाता है ।
मोबाइल सेल पंजीकरण का शेष समय दिखाता है ।
अनुमति देता है डायन यह अनुदान की जरूरत है दिखाता है ।
ईवेंट के प्रारंभ के बारे में सूचना दिखाता है ।
कृपया PhoneProfilesPlusExtender का नया संस्करण स्थापित करें । स्थापना के बारे में अधिक जानकारी के लिए PhoneProfilesPlusExtender आवश्यक है जो पैरामीटर्स में है ।
Click here to display PhoneProfilesPlusExtender releases in GitHub.
आवेदन करने के लिए मजबूर इसे बंद
सक्षम करने के लिए \"बलपूर्वक अनुप्रयोग रोकें\" पैरामीटर, PhoneProfilesPlusExtender स्थापित करने के लिए यहां क्लिक करें ।
PhoneProfilesPlusExtender का नया संस्करण आवश्यक है। इसे अपग्रेड करने के लिए यहां क्लिक करें
फोर्स स्टॉप एप्लिकेशन\" पैरामीटर को सक्षम करने के लिए, सिस्टम सेटिंग्स में PhoneProfilesPlusExtender \"पहुंच\" की अनुमति दें।
It works only when the screen is on and unlocked.

Allow PhoneProfilesPlusExtender \"Accessibility\" in system settings. Accessibility function is not used, running service is needed for receiving SMS and MMS.
Click here to install PhoneProfilesPlusExtender. Running service is needed for receiving SMS and MMS.

Due to a change of rules by Google, about usage of permissions for receive SMS and MMS, you must install PhoneProfilesPlusExtender to use the SMS/MMS event sensor. Check the parameters of this sensor for more information.
Allow PhoneProfilesPlusExtender for:\n• profile parameter \"Force stop applications\"\n• event parameters \"Application sensor\", \"Orientation sensor\", \"SMS/MMS sensor\".
• Accessibility service for profile parameter \"Force stop applications\":
• Accessibility service for event parameters \"Application sensor\" and \"Orientation sensor\":
• Accessibility service for event parameter \"SMS/MMS sensor\". Accessibility function is not used, service is needed for receiving SMS and MMS.:
